intro: Cymbalaria ebelii, commonly known as the yellow-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has oval, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, grassy areas. Cymbalaria ebelii is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
